# Introduction {#intro}

Acronyms can be set to upper case for both short name and long name: \acr[case=upper,case_target=both]{ai}.

In upper case for only the short name: \acr[case=upper,case_target=short,first_use]{ai}.

In upper case for only the long name: \acr[case=upper,case_target=long,first_use]{ai}.

They can be set to lower case for both short name and long name: \acr[case=lower,case_target=both]{RL}.

In lower case for only the short name: \acr[case=lower,case_target=short,first_use]{RL}.

In lower case for only the long name: \acr[case=lower,case_target=long,first_use]{RL}.

Or they can be set to sentence case for both short name and long name: \acr[case=sentence,case_target=both]{mRNA}.

In sentence case for only the short name: \acr[case=sentence,case_target=short,first_use]{mRNA}.

In sentence case for only the long name: \acr[case=sentence,case_target=long,first_use]{mRNA}.
